item.title: Blox Fruits: How to Unlock All the Secret Gravity Moves
item.description:
In Blox Fruits , players can use different Fruits to grind or fight in PvP. Most of them can be upgraded by completing raids or earning Mastery, but some have secret skills.

Gravity is a powerful Fruit that can control gravity, such as pulling meteors to the ground. On top of that, its full potential is revealed only after several secret upgrades. For those looking to gain access to such power, here's how to unlock all the secret Gravity moves in Blox Fruits .

How to Unlock All the Secret Gravity Moves in Blox Fruits

At first, you may think that the Gravity Fruit is no different from the others. You, like always, need to use it and earn EXP to increase mastery and unlock new moves. However, this is not all, since by completing quests for the Mysterious Scientist in Blox Fruits , you can unlock all the secret Gravity moves .

This NPC gives players access to a special device called the Admin Panel. You will find Gravity Fruit research in it, which you will need to complete. As a reward for each such quest, your moves will become much stronger.

Where to Find the Mysterious Scientist in Blox Fruits

Luckily, there are two locations where players can find the Mysterious Scientist in Blox Fruits . The first place where you can find him is in the Second Sea on the Hot and Cold Island . Enter the Factory building and then click on the colored panels in the following order:

  • Red, Blue, Green, Blue

After that, go through the door and go up the stairs to find the NPC.

The second location is in the Third Sea in Castle on the Sea . Simply go to the main building, and in the right corridor, you will find the Mysterious Scientist.

All Secret Gravity Quests in Blox Fruits

The quests follow in order, so you will have to complete them all in order to unlock all the secret Gravity Moves in Blox Fruits . You should also be prepared to spend a lot of resources on it.

Quest

Description

Requirements

Rewards

Kinetic Amplifier

Defeat any 15 enemies using the M1 of Gravity.

1,000 Fragments 2 Radioactive Material 1 Mystic Droplet

You can hold M1 to increase its damage and range.

Kinetic Amplifier 2

Defeat any 30 enemies using the M1 of Gravity.

2,000 Fragments 4 Radioactive Material 2 Mystic Droplet

You can hold M1 even longer.

Dark Matter Implosion

You have to use Gravity moves on ships 20 times.

6,000 Fragments 6 Radioactive Material 4 Mystic Droplet 1 Meteorite

You gain a Gravitational Force Meter that fills as you deal damage. Also, your C Move becomes more powerful and consumes some of the meter when held.

Celestial Cataclysm

Use M1 on water 20 times until you complete the quest. Then, defeat the Orbitus boss using Gravity Fruit. Alternatively, you can beat other players 6 times.

10,000 Fragments 8 Mystic Droplet 2 Moonstones 2 Meteorite

Your V move also drains your Gravitational Force Meter when held. Now you pull enemies into a certain area and then throw a piece of the moon at them.

item.title: Path of Exile 2: Unholy Might Explained
item.description:
In Path of Exile 2 , Witch players who choose the Lich Ascendancy will be able to gain access to a buff called Unholy Might through two of the Ascendancy passives: Necromantic Conduit and Blackened Heart.

The in-game tooltip description states that Unholy Might converts 30% of all damage into extra Chaos damage for that character, but the behind-the-scenes calculations may be different from what many players may imagine. Here’s the breakdown.

How Does Unholy Might Work in PoE 2

Unholy Might has the following description:

Unholy Might is a buff that grants 30% of all damage as extra Chaos Damage.

What’s confusing about this buff is that the ‘30% of all Damage’ seems like a lot, but in actual practice, it doesn’t seem very impressive. To understand why this is, we have to understand how the ‘extra’ conversion works in PoE 2.

If you have a damage source that does 100 Lightning Damage, 30% of that damage will be converted to Chaos and added on top of the base damage type. This means you would do 100 Lightning damage and 30 Chaos Damage, for a total of 130 damage. The base damage value is not converted to Chaos.

Now, the tricky part is that if you have an item that, for example, gives you 50% increased Lightning damage (let’s say Earthbound ), it does not apply to the Chaos damage in any way, shape, or form. This means that with Unholy Might and 80% increased Lightning damage Earthbound; you would do 180 Lightning damage and 30 Chaos damage. 80% of 100 is 80, which added to 100 is 180, so 180 Lightning damage. Chaos damage is calculated based on the base value of 100.

If you do have increased Chaos damage modifiers, the extra Chaos damage would be buffed by it, but only that. So, if you have 50% increased Chaos damage, it would mean the damage would be 100 Lightning damage + 30 Chaos damage + 15 Chaos Damage (from the 50% modifier).

The only exception to this is if your base damage type is also Chaos damage. This would make it so that the scaling values would apply to both the base value and the extra Chaos damage gained from Unholy Might.

The ‘extra Chaos damage’ from Unholy Might does not apply to damage over time; it only applies to Hits.

Because the scaling of the base damage type and the extra damage type if they are different, Unholy Might only really works when it is used in a mono-Chaos damage-focused build that scales with only this damage type.

What Does ‘Presence’ in Unholy Might Mean

Presence refers to the area of effect within which Unholy Might will be active . By default, this area has a 4-meter radius, but this can be increased using Presence Area Modifiers, typically found on Sceptres, Time-Lost Jewels, and certain Notables in the passive skill tree like Enveloping Essence, Long Distance Relationship, and Profane Commander.

Presence is only affected by ‘Increased Presence Area of Effect’, not by ‘Increased Area of Effect’ or ‘More Area of Effect.’

How to Get Unholy Might in PoE 2

There are two ways to get access to Unholy Might in Path of Exile 2 .

  • Lich Ascendancy (Witch Class)
    • Necromantic Conduit: While you are not on Low Mana, you and Allies in your Presence have Unholy Might. Lose 5% of maximum Mana per Second.

  • Vis Mortis Plated Raiment Unique Body Armor
    • (70–100)% increased Energy Shield
    • +(70–100) to maximum Mana
    • Minions have 50% reduced maximum Life
    • Minions have Unholy Might

With Vis Mortis, only the minions summoned by the wearer gain Unholy Might; the character does not.

item.title: Blue Prince: How To Solve The Laboratory Number Puzzle
item.description:
In Blue Prince , there are more than 100 rooms that each have unique puzzles, hints, and lore inside of them. There are also a selection of places with puzzles that require specific tiles adjacent or nearby, and one of these is Blue Prince 's Laboratory.

The Laboratory in Blue Prince has a lot of things going on inside of it, and you might be confused as to what items go with which puzzles. If you are having trouble figuring out the answer to the Lab's number puzzle, this article is here to help you out.

How to Solve the Laboratory Machine Puzzle

The first thing you need to do in order to solve the Laboratory machine puzzle is to route power to the Laboratory itself. Power is generated by tiles labeled Power Source, like the Boiler Room in Blue Prince . Once you have the power up and running, you need to connect the Lab directly to the power source or across tiles that also have power conduits built into the ceiling like the Gymnasium, Security, Passageway, and others. You can tell if the power will run through it if it surrounded by a blue light as in the screenshot below.

After that, you will need to pull the right levers in the correct order, and it will give you a permanent unlock for Blue Prince . In order to solve the lever puzzle, you will need to look closely at all the posters around the room.

The Solution to the Lever Lab Machine Puzzle

There are two different posters on the walls of the Laboratory that you can interact with. One is the Periodic Table of Elements, and another is the Periodic Table but it is mostly empty. There are numbers in the empty one, and each of those corresponds to an element, represented by either one or two letters (for example, B for Boron or He for Helium). Using the order of the numbers on the mostly-empty chart, take the letters for each of those element positions and make a sentence. Number 1 is in the same location as Plutonium ( Pu ), Number 2 is in the same location as Sulfur ( S ), and 3 is where Hydrogen ( H ) is. So the first word of the puzzle is "PUSH."

If you figure out all the numbers and the letter that correspond to them, you will find the answer is "pushthreeupafternine," or Push Three Up After Nine . You need to push the 9th lever on the machine first, then the 3rd.

Once those two have been pushed up in that order, you'll get your reward: the Blackbridge Grotto. This allows you to access one offline terminal per day from any terminal. These are Security, the Laboratory, the Blue Prince Office, and the Bunker. There may be more, but these are all the terminals available at the beginning of the game.

item.title: Death Stranding 2: Who Could the Mysterious Pale Character Be?
item.description:
Summary

  • The mysterious pale character in Death Stranding 2 may be a DHV Magellan crew member based on their tattoo and past images.
  • Alternatively, the character could be the real mother of Rainy's baby from Tomorrow's world, forming a potential strong bond.
  • Despite the character's enigmatic role, Death Stranding 2 continues to leave fans with many unanswered questions about the story and characters.

Hideo Kojima, creator of the 2019 hit action-adventure game Death Stranding , has not held back in offering fans an extensive look at Death Stranding 2: On the Beach . Its State of Play and pre-order trailers are both over ten minutes long, with plenty of introductions when it comes to story, characters, features, and more. However, despite those two lengthy trailers, there are still a multitude of questions about Death Stranding 2 , particularly when it comes to the story and its characters. One character, in particular, appeared for a split second in Death Stranding 2 's pre-order trailer, and fans have only been able to speculate on who they might be.

Around six minutes into Death Stranding 2 's pre-order trailer, a mysterious pale character with a shaved head appears next to two other new characters, Rainy and Doctor. In the scene, the character is shown standing next to Rainy, who is holding a baby in an artificial womb in her hands and smiling. The character then affectionately places their hands on Rainy's shoulders, as though they not only have a strong connection to Rainy herself, but potentially the baby as well. The scene is only a couple of seconds long, leaving a lot of unanswered questions about the new character's role in the story.

Who Death Stranding 2's Mysterious Pale Character Could Be

They Could Simply Be a Fellow DHV Magellan Crew Member

While the mysterious character's role in Death Stranding 2 could be much deeper than this, it's reasonable to consider that they could simply be a fellow crew member of the DHV Magellan, the mobile base of operations for the new organization Drawbridge, led by Fragile. This theory comes as a result of the tattoo on the character's head, which is the DHV Magellan logo. Additionally, Kojima shared a Death Stranding 2 image in a post on X several months ago that showed the pale character fully armed, further suggesting their potential role as a crew member of the DHV Magellan.

There are still a multitude of questions about Death Stranding 2 , particularly when it comes to the story and its characters.

Perhaps, in light of the scene shown in Death Stranding 2 's pre-order trailer, they are a friend to Rainy and are simply a part of a supportive environment for Rainy and her new baby. It has been confirmed that Rainy actually carries the baby herself, though why the baby ends up in an artificial womb similar to those that house Bridge Babies remains unknown and likely will stay that way until Death Stranding 2 's launch.

They Could Be a Mother From Tomorrow's World

Another intriguing theory that seems to be a bit more likely is that the pale character actually came from Tomorrow's world and is the real mother of Rainy's baby. In a scene from Death Stranding 2 's Tokyo Games Show trailer, Tomorrow says to Rainy, "In the place where I came from, no one gave birth to babies. They just stayed inside their mothers' bellies." It could be that the pale character is actually from Tomorrow's world in Death Stranding 2 , and in order for her baby to be born, it had to be transferred to a surrogate. Based on the scene the character shares with Rainy and Doctor, it would be assumed, then, that Doctor is the one who makes this happen.

This would effectively make the baby the child of both Rainy and the pale character and potentially leads to a strong bond between the two characters.

Death Stranding 2 hasn't offered many answers to very much at all at this point, let alone the mysterious pale character in its pre-order trailer. The character's tender moment with Rainy, her DHV Magellan tattoo, and her armored appearance in one of Hideo Kojima's X posts all suggest a deeper role than just background crew. But if she really is the biological mother of Rainy's child — someone from Tomorrow's world who could never give birth on her own — then her connection to Rainy might carry far more emotional weight than expected.

item.title: Roblox: Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY Codes (April 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY Codes
  • How to Redeem Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY Codes
  • How to Get More Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY Codes

Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY is probably one of the most popular clicker simulators on the platform. Players only need to blow bubble gum and sell it to progress. But the better the gum you buy, the more effort it will take to blow it. Therefore, we recommend you take a look at the Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY codes.

As expected from Roblox codes, they contain various goodies from the developers. You can even find high-tier potions. However, players should hurry, as their validity period is limited.

Updated April 20, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: There are currently three active codes in Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY , each offering a helpful bonus. One gives you a Mystery Box, while the other provides a Luck Potion V to boost your chances. It’s a small but useful set of rewards worth claiming. More codes could arrive with future updates, so be sure to check back regularly.

All Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY Codes

Working Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY Codes

  • easter - Redeem this code to get a reward. (NEW)
  • RELEASE - Redeem this code to get Mystery Box
  • Lucky - Redeem this code to get Luck Potion V

Expired Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY Codes

  • Thanks - Redeem this code to get 2 Mystery Boxes

At the beginning of your adventure, you will blow bubble gum and buy new upgrades quite quickly. However, without additional multipliers, you will not achieve much. So, players should invest part of the earned money in hatching pets. As always, different eggs drop different pets, each of which has unique multipliers. And if you want to get all the rare animals in a short time, then Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY codes will help you with this.

Most of these Roblox codes grant players Mystery Boxes. When you open one, you will randomly receive different items, such as money, Gems, or even Potions. At the same time, some rare codes can offer you 5-tier potions. So you definitely do not want to miss them.

How to Redeem Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY Codes

Using codes in Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY is no different from most other Roblox games. So, most players will have no problem with it. If this is your first gaming experience, then you just need to follow these simple steps:

  • First, launch Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY .
  • Then, click on the Codes button on the left side of the screen.
  • After that, enter the code in the corresponding window.
  • Finally, click Redeem to claim free goodies.

How to Get More Bubble Gum Simulator INFINITY Codes

Now that you know how these Roblox codes can speed up your progress, you will want to know how not to miss new rewards from the developers. To do this, players must follow the developers' official social media pages. There you will find all the latest news first-hand:

  • Rumble Studios YouTube channel
  • Rumble Studios X page
  • Rumble Studios Discord server
